Benefits of generative AI features The generative AI features in Acrobat and Acrobat Reader significantly improve comprehension, help you get insights, and produce high-quality content quickly. Here are the main benefits. - Improved comprehension: You can better understand complex PDF documents because the features provide insights and more context around the content. - Enhanced productivity: Work across multiple PDFs and documents in various formats, including Teams and Zoom meeting transcripts, streamlining your workflow and saving time for higher-priority tasks. - Impactful content: You can use the content suggestions that the features generate for impactful emails, presentations, meeting notes, and more. Turn off generative AI features The generative AI features in Acrobat and Acrobat Reader are turned on by default. However, you can choose to turn them off, if necessary. If you're an admin, you can revoke access to generative AI features for your team or org by contacting Adobe Customer Care. User Guidelines User Guidelines governing your access and use of Acrobat and Acrobat Reader generative AI features are found here. In addition, please always use your judgment to evaluate generated output and any source attributions. Acrobat and Acrobat Reader generative AI features are built upon powerful, emerging large language model technologies that may generate outputs that are inaccurate or misleading, or otherwise reflect content that does not represent Adobeï¿½s views. This is especially true if you try to use these features to generate outputs that are unrelated to your source document. Do not use generative AI features to seek legal, medical, financial, or other kinds of professional advice or any opinions, judgments, or recommendations without conducting your own independent consultation or research. Generative AI features cannot replace advice provided by a qualified professional and do not form any such relationship (for example, an attorney-client relationship). Sharing Checklist for Real Estate Professionals In the real estate industry, sharing documents efficiently is crucial for closing deals and keeping clients informed. Here's a tailored checklist to help you manage your PDF sharing needs. Real Estate Sharing Checklist �x Open Your Property Document �x Have you launched Acrobat or Acrobat Reader and opened the property listing or contract you need to share? �x Choose Your Sharing Method �x Are you sharing via email, link, or a third-party app like Microsoft Teams or WhatsApp? �x Set Permissions �x Have you decided if clients can comment on the document or just view it? �x Add Clients and Stakeholders

�x Did you enter the email addresses of clients, agents, and other stakeholders? �x Customize Your Message �x Have you added a personal touch to the subject and message fields, highlighting key property details? �x Create and Share the Link �x Did you generate a shareable link and copy it for distribution? �x Send the Invitation �x Have you sent the email or shared the link through your chosen platform? �x Follow Up �x Are you tracking who has accessed the document and following up with clients for feedback or next steps? Professional Tip: Highlight Key Details Make sure to emphasize important property details in your message to capture your clients' attention. Conclusion Sharing PDFs with Adobe Acrobat is straightforward and efficient, whether you're working on a general project or managing real estate documents. By following these checklists, you can ensure that your sharing process is smooth and professional. Start sharing smarter today.
